result.execSummary:
Brandon Cornelius Blain Jr was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Brandon Cornelius Blain Jr was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Cornelius Blain Jr

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 10:45 AM 
Defendant Brandon Cornelius Blain not in court.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court record. 

Per information received from the jail Mr. Blain was picked up by Iowa on 6/2/22.

The Court indicates that case should be closed; takes no further action.
recess: 10:46am
Review hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Extradition Commitment Warrant

ec/pc: DA, JCJ, Governor (6/2/22--ma)

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 2:07pm  
Defendant Brandon Cornelius Blain Jr. appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (the PD appears for bond-purposes only; Mr. Blain is not eligible for PD representation).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Counsel agree that the Zoom video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
Attorney Barteck indicates that she has reviewed right to counsel with Mr. Blain.
Attorney Barteck verifies that she has reviewed extradition rights with Mr. Blain, and he intends to waive his extradition rights.  
The Court finds that the Defendant is the same person as who is charged in the State of Iowa. 
recess 2:10pm 
reconvene  2:49pm with the same appearances, however the parties are now present in the Courtroom 
Mr. Blain signs the four Extradition Waiver forms in the presence of the Court. 
The Court finds that Mr. Blain has knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to an extradition hearing. The Court commits Mr. Blain to the Jefferson County Jail for a period of not more than thirty days to await the Governor's Warrant pick up and transport by Iowa officials.  
Mr. Blain then requests that the Court set bail. 
After hearing arguments on bail, the Court vacates the Order regarding the Commitment, and instead the Court requires a $5,000 Cash Bond with no special conditions. 
recess 2:57pm 
[clerk's inserted note:  one of the signed and notarized Waiver of Extradition and Hearing forms is provided to the Jefferson County Jail Deputy at the conclusion of the hearing.] 

NEXT:  Review Hearing on June 21st at 10:00am
